name: Chord Changes
description: Practice smooth chord transitions from open chords through barre chords and common progressions.

steps.name: Open Chord Review
steps.instructions: Play through each open chord shape. Strum each once and check that every string rings clearly. Adjust finger placement as needed.
steps.notes: If any chord buzzes, isolate the problem string and fix your finger position before moving on.

steps.name: Two-Chord Switches — Slow
steps.instructions: Switch between G and C every 4 beats. Strum on beat 1, let it ring, then switch. Focus on landing all fingers simultaneously rather than one at a time.
steps.notes: The goal is accuracy, not speed. Clean changes first.

steps.name: Two-Chord Switches — Medium
steps.instructions: Same G to C changes, but now switch every 2 beats. Strum on each beat. Keep your fingers close to the fretboard during transitions.

steps.name: Barre Chord Introduction
steps.instructions: Practice the F major barre chord shape at the first fret. Press firmly with your index finger across all 6 strings. Pick each string individually to check for buzzing. Adjust until every string sounds clean.
steps.notes: Barre chords take time. Don't get frustrated — focus on small improvements each session.

steps.name: Barre Chord Changes
steps.instructions: Switch between F barre chord and open C chord every 4 beats. This is a challenging transition — take your time.
steps.notes: If you can't make the switch in time, just mute the strings on the beat and catch up.

steps.name: Chord Progression: I-IV-V-I
steps.instructions: Play the progression G - C - D - G. Give each chord one full measure (4 beats). Strum a simple down-down-up-down-up pattern. Repeat the progression continuously.

steps.name: Free Play — Apply Chord Changes
steps.instructions: Pick a song you know and practice the chord changes at your own pace. Focus on the transitions that feel weakest.
